title: Bimatrix game
summary: In game theory, a bimatrix game is a simultaneous game for two players in which each player has a finite number of possible actions. The name comes from the fact that the normal form of such a game can be described by two matrices - matrix A {\displaystyle A} describing the payoffs of player 1 and matrix B {\displaystyle B} describing the payoffs of player 2.[1]
